DEFECT.DESCRIPTION: The Drivers module has inferred that the current function is a DRIVER_INITIALIZE function: This is informational only. No problem has been detected.

The dispatch function 'HookDeviceRead' does not have any __drv_dispatchType annotations: This can be corrected by adding appropriate __drv_dispatchType annotations to the function. Unnecessary casts can cause this warning.

The dispatch function 'HookDevicePassThrough' does not have any __drv_dispatchType annotations: This can be corrected by adding appropriate __drv_dispatchType annotations to the function. Unnecessary casts can cause this warning.
The function being assigned or passed should be a DRIVER_DISPATCH function: Add the declaration 'DRIVER_DISPATCH HookDevicePassThrough;' before the current first declaration of HookDevicePassThrough.
The function being assigned or passed should be a DRIVER_DISPATCH function: Add the declaration 'DRIVER_DISPATCH HookDeviceRead;' before the current first declaration of HookDeviceRead.
The function being assigned or passed should be a DRIVER_UNLOAD function: Add the declaration 'DRIVER_UNLOAD HookDeviceUnload;' before the current first declaration of HookDeviceUnload.
